sentence.text: He found aspects of Zhukov 's business highly distasteful , even though he had come expressly to use them .
For his pains , he was treated disrespectfully by guest players and placed at the centre of the most distasteful charade ever seen on an English first-class cricket field .
She found it most distasteful to think of him owing money to the bingo-playing woman in the basement .
Such action becomes particularly distasteful when it is carried out by elected representatives .
Airdrie 's behaviour this season has been distasteful .
It must have been distasteful for a man whose principles were always of the very highest .
Now , all the simplistic stereotyping of the femme characters is fairly distasteful …
It is a distasteful subject but it must be faced for a few moments .
Better to be disgraced for distasteful habits and withholding evidence from the police than jailed for murder ?
The thought was distasteful but it continued to play on her mind as she got dressed in a pair of jeans and a flowered silk shirt .
But today he was on edge , anxious to have a distasteful duty done , careful that there should be no mistakes .

Even the recognition of sexual activity as being joyful and pleasurable , rather than a distasteful duty of marriage , is less frequent among older people ( especially women ) than among younger ones .

In both cases where the context is available however , the bare infinitive is used in reference to the undergoing of unpleasant treatment , where the speaker clearly wishes to stress the realization of a distasteful experience which was forced upon him .
She also found it distasteful to be discussing Nora 's lover in this way .
Mme Guérigny , whilst relying on her son , still found it distasteful that he was managing to survive in the face of the family tragedy .
However distasteful it may be to some people , this does at least provide a rational explanation for the behaviour of those bystanders , even if it does not excuse them .
First , it means that there must be some form of cost/benefit analysis , however distasteful it is to assign money values to life or ill-health .
` But not quite so mercenary , and I find it exceedingly distasteful for you to arrogantly assume you might understand my sister a great deal better than I ever could .
But can I really maintain that the affliction is “ visible , painful , incurable , distasteful to others ” … ?
This feature of quantum mechanics proved very distasteful to some of the very men who had helped to create the subject .
Big or small , firms will now need management skills -- a novel , often distasteful notion among lawyers -- no less than legal ones .
Distasteful behaviour is a trait of mankind , not a national characteristic .
Events in India made this distasteful task unnecessary .
Chertro 's grin altered to a distasteful leer .
And he must have known that she found his touch distasteful , yet did that stop him ?
And that faced her with a course of action which , for some obscure reason , seemed rather distasteful now .
